• Urvashi

    Singh

  • About(current)
  • Research



Hello, I am an Immunology Data Analyst at CellCarta. I am a recent graduate in Microbiology and Immunology from McGill University. My research interests are at the intersection of infectious diseases, genomics, and bioinformatics. I am a passionate advocate for health care equity and accessibility.

I collaborate with the Langlais Lab at the McGill Genome Centre for bioinformatics projects. Currently, I am contributing to a project investigating the effect of thermoregulation on the immune response to Leishmania infections in a murine model.

Previously, I contributed to the End TB Goal at the Pai Global TB Group and researched the public-private mix for healthcare in high TB burden countries.

I am also an artist, and I donate all profits to grassroots organizations for COVID-19 relief in India. Find my art here.




Latest
  • One paper submitted to Stem Cell Translational Medicine and one paper under review in the Journal of Clinical Tuberculosis and Other Mycobacterial Diseases in 2022
  • Poster presented at the Till & McCulloch Meetings 2021 with TMM2021 Special Award
  • Advocacy article on equity, diversity, and inclusion in The Lancet 2021
  • Advocacy op-ed on quality of TB care in Spotlight 2021
